intro: Leymus secalinus var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent wheatgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and hairy, pubescent leaves that give it its common name. Due to its hardy nature and nutritional value, it is sometimes used in forage agriculture and ecological restoration projects.
